result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth P Shank was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Court waived costs, fees and surcharges, as it is part of a continuous course of conduct. Cash bail applied. If revoked, court costs, fees, fines and surcharges to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds and earnings.
- Restitution set at ZERO.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

- AODA assessment and comply with any treatment/counseling deemed appropriate.
- Continue attending support groups at least once per month. Provide proof of attendance to agent.
- Maintain employment of at least 30 hours per week. Participate in vocational training.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Pay a $300.00 fine plus all costs, fees, surcharges and fines during period of probation. Court waived DNA surcharge as it is part of a continuous course of conduct. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied. If revoked, court costs, fees, fines and surcharges to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds and earnings.
Defendant may apply for occupational license when eligible

Defendant to report to HOC on 09-04-15 by 10am. Defendant may have release to care for his elderly mother for no more than 8 hours per day, five days per week, Monday through Friday. Defendant may not have release for elderly care on Saturday and Sunday. Court recommends the defendant participate in the Day Reporting Center. Defendant may have release for employment. Defendant may participate in vocational programming.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Count three, per Order signed on 9/29/2015:  JOC shall be amended by removin the consecutive designation on the sentence on count three.

/signed and filed.

Defendant Kenneth P Shank in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in Counts 2 and 4.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Counts 2 and 4 dismissed but read in. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as to Count 1, as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Defense counsel requested a presentence report.  Order for Presentence Investigation signed and filed.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

State did not object. Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
